page.title: 15ECOLOGY 2
page.content: life - animals,birds,insects and plants.These are - intensively farmed land,pasture land and woodland. Intensively farmed land covers the level area south of the A9 but still provides extensive cover for wildlife by way of road verges,hedges,drainage ditches and scattered areas of both deciduous and coniferous woodland. Pasture lend is the largest single habitat and is found minly north of the A9. It can be either improved grassland or rough pasture.This last is pehaps the most natural of the habitats. Similar cover as in intensively farmed land will be found for wildlife but woodland is more extensive and includes a considerable variety ofdeciduous trees - amongst others beech,birch and alder:the last providing an excellent home for migrating thrushes and redwings.
